item.title: The Boys of The Hole
item.description:
Inspired by a Christian preacher band in Brodick and a hole under a rock on the cock of Lochranza in Arran.

To the tune of drunken sailor in a low voice.

—

Chorus:

We are the boys of the hole, We sit here and stay dry and warm, We are the boys of the hole, Here sheltering from the storm.

–

Well hello traveller walking there, I’ve been down here for 20 odd year, Did you know that it’s good manners to knock? ‘ave you been living under a rock?

item.title: A letter to TV Licensing
item.description:
Dear TV Licensing,

I would like to assure you that, during these trying times, our media consumption is strictly limited to:

  • the oral tradition,
  • folk-based musical ceremony,
  • the Sunday Times, purchased fortnightly.

We do not, have not, nor will we ever consume, ingest or otherwise allow our spirits to be blessed by televised content, conveyed to us by the LCD, Plasma, LED, or even Cathode Ray Tube screens, whether large or small.
